From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To enable error-disable detection, use the **errdisable detect cause**command in global configuration mode. To disable error-disable detection, use the **no** form of this command.
CLIs: errdisable detect cause { all | bpduguard | dtp-flap | l2ptguard | link-flap | packet-buffer-error | pagp-flap | rootguard | udld }
no errdisable detect cause { all | bpduguard | dtp-flap | l2ptguard | link-flap | pagp-flap | rootguard | udld }

ParaDef.Info: Specifies error-disable detection for all error-disable causes.
Specifies detection for the Bridge Protocol Data Unit (BPDU)-guard error-disable cause.
Specifies detection for the Dynamic Trunking Protocol (DTP)-flap error-disable cause.
Specifies detection for the Layer 2 Protocol Tunneling guard error-disable cause.
Specifies detection for the link flap error-disable cause.
Causes the packet buffer error to error-disable the affected port.
Specifies detection for the Port Aggregation Protocol (PAgP)-flap error-disable cause.
Specifies detection for the root-guard error-disable cause.
Specifies detection for the Unidirectional Link Detection (UDLD) error-disable cause.

ExtraInfo: ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/note.gif)---**Note** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)Entering the **no errdisable detect cause packet-buffer-error** command allows you to detect the fault that triggers a power cycle of the affected module.---A cause (bpduguard, dtp-flap, link-flap, pagp-flap, root-guard, udld) is defined as the reason why the error-disable state occurred. When a cause is detected on an interface, the interface is placed in an error-disable state (an operational state that is similiar to the link-down state).You must enter the **shutdown** and then the **no shutdown** commands to recover an interface manually from the error-disable state.

RelatedCmds.description: Displays the interface status or a list of interfaces in an error-disable state on LAN ports only.
